We Want to Hear From You!

Your mission, should you deci…

Oh, who are we kidding? This isn\’t a mission. You aren\’t a special agent and you aren\’t Robin Hood.

This is about redistributing some wealth, from T.O.P. (The One Percent) Guy to YOU. He has it. You want it. Go get it. He’s got so much of it that he leaves gold bars laying around the construction sites of his new City of the Future.

And he\’s so stingy he\’s only using outdated, not-so-smart robotic sentries to guard it.

So he\’s just begging you to come… liberate some of that coin, right?!?

Your only weapons are two stasis field generators you…procured, from… doesn\’t matter.

Once you acquire all of the gold bars from a site, an escape ladder will appear allowing you to escape to the next site.

So let\’s go! Everything you ever wanted is right here for the taking. Indulge!

The construction sites are protected by a number of robot sentries. They generally behave in predictable ways but sometimes can surprise you.

The sentries are also capable of carrying gold bars.

When not carrying a gold bar, a sentry has a roving red scanner in its chest:
When carrying a gold bar, the a sentry\'s chest scanner turns gold:
You can confiscate a gold bar that a sentry is carrying by trapping the sentry in a stasis field.
Platforms move vertically or horizontally, at variable speeds, and stay docked for variable lengths of time.

Teleporters can either be bi-directional, capable of both sending and receiving passengers, or uni-directional, capable of either sending or receiving. Teleporters that can receive can receive from any transmitting teleporter.

Stasis fields are your only weapon. They allow you to block sentries from moving past them.

You have access to two stasis field generators. Each can generate only one field at a time.

The controls allow you to generate a stasis field to either side of your player, regardless of which direction the player is facing.

When a sentry is carrying a gold bar, you can take it from him by firing a field as the sentry starts to move over it, trapping it inside.
Stasis fields also prevent the player from passing through them, except for when a sentry is trapped in them.

Multiple control schemes exist to fit your personal preference.

In some schemes the game screen is larger.

Game control has been designed to be as forgiving and flexible as possible.

If you haven't completely moved on or above a ladder, or if you have slightly run past it, and tap up or down, the controls will move you into position to climb the ladder.

If you are tapping on a horizontal button and a vertical button at the same time, the controls will continue in your current direction until the other direction is available to travel in.
For game controllers, the \'X\' button or the left shoulder button can be used to fire the left stasis field. The \'B\' button or right shoulder button fires the right stasis field.
